subject: Double Your Pleasure
event:
Life is magical and full of joy.

Great wins today by both the Jets and Giants, though the two games could not have been more different.  Gang Green absolutely destroyed the Rams, leading 40-0 at the half, and coasting to an easy 47-3 victory.  This year's incarnation of the Rams look truly pathetic, true, but in the years past the Jets have shown a tendency to play down to the level of their opponents and lose such games.  Years past?  No, make that weeks past.  The loss to Oakland just a few weeks back still rankles.  Anyway, it did not happen this week, and the Jets look primed and ready for Thursday's big showdown with the Patriots for first place in the AFC East.

The Giants game was a whole different animal.  Their annual contests with the Eagles are always hard-fought, and this was no exception.  The G-Men dominated yardage and time of possession with their monstrous three-headed running game, but somehow they could never quite put the Iggles away, so the decision came down to the final two minutes of the fourth.  It was a sloppy game, marked by lots of turnovers (I love Brandon Jacobs, but I hope Coughlin tells him to stop trying to jump over tacklers.  He does much better when he just plows into them), but a damned exciting one.  My heart was in my throat as time ran down, until the Giants defense stuffed Westbrook on those two final runs, and settled the matter.  Replay challenges played a huge role in the outcome as well -- one crucial one by Coughlin, which he won, and two foolish ones by Andy Reid, both of which he lost.

A win is a win, though, and the Giants now sit at 8-1, with a commanding lead in the NFC East.  Their schedule only gets harder from here, though.  Next week it's the Ravens with that brutal defense of theirs.  Should be another great game, for those who like D.

comments.article: Giants are playing better than last year, and that season ended pretty well.
I expect the KC Chiefs to lose every game, but I'm encouraged by Thigpen's performance.  Let him gel and maybe there's hope for next year.
I understand that their season is long since over, but I still don't think that was the time to go for two. You always that the extra point & try to win it in OT.

The Jets are winning because of Brett, stupid Packers letting him go! I like Aaron, but he needs seasoning and a lesson in toughness from his Mentor! GO JET(disgruntled Packer Fan, my team still but so much less without Brett!)
Hmmm, maybe the Gints will again face an undefeated opponent in the Big Dance.

I love how the Eagles had possession of the ball for ninety seconds in the first quarter. It was a fun game, and it gave me more hope that the Giants can overcome the rest of their opponents.

Maybe.
My Titans are still undefeated! Nothing would please me more than to see our teams match up for the big one. Of course at that point I would quit cheering for yours and shout for only the Titans. ;-)
comments.subject: Titans

comments.article: Go Titans!
comments.subject: Re: Titans

comments.article: My injury-battered and offensively anemic Seahawks actually played pretty well, but still managed to lose to the Fish.  Robinson dropped an easy score that should have put the 'Hawks up 17-14 at the time, but they had to settle for 3.  That 4 points lost turned out to be the difference, thanks to a missed 2pt conversion. I thought they might pull it out anyway, but Holmgren's poor play calling on the final drive killed us. All we needed was a damn field goal! Instead, there's Seneca Wallace running for his life trying to throw downfield when all we needed was about 10 more yards.

"Life is magical and full of joy."

We expect to read Dolorous Edd saying this at some point before the series is done.

(Maybe just before he gets turned into a wight.)

The Dolphins edged the Seahawks, so I'm happy.
The Jets are tied for 1st & the Fins are one game out. Have I been transported to some warped parallel universe or something?

Here in Indy football has been truely maddening but the one true constant has been that little brother has the most exciting team surrounding him in football.Heres to the Manning Bowl come Feburary. Or maybe I should be very careful of what I wish for.

p.s. my fantasy football teams are all named after Ice and Fire characters. Tyrion, The Hound, Hodor, and Little Finger
comments.subject: Go big blue ... from indy

comments.article:
Was wondering about the Giants call with 4:00 left in the 4th. Ran the ball to the right and just got piled up behind the offensive line. Then, stupidly considering they have McNabb and no short yardage running game, the Eagles decided to do the same thing and run Westbrook twice and that ended it.

And you are correct about Giant players remebering they're football players and not hurdlers. Looks cool but only 1 thing good can come from hurdling players and several really bad things can happen. 250 lb guys shouldn't really be doing that. :)

Concerned about the Ravens. They seemed to have found an offense. How'd that happen?

They found a Quarterback to finally lead the team after a long string of cast-offs and back-ups.  The Ravens and Titans are truly scary teams in the AFC this season.  I wouldn't be at all surprised to see them meet for the AFC Championship.

great coaching job by Coughlin. I was thinking of Chris Collinsworth's remark to Tikki Barber after the game: "If you're sitting here calling the plays the Eagles are about to run, you bet the Giants down on the field know too."

Lucky too I have a local bar in Phoenix that features all the NY games.

Next week should be interesting, though I fear what Eli is going to do to the barely existent Ravens secondary.   Right now though, I'm going to continue to enjoy being tied for first in the AFC North thanks to the Colts win last night.
Only time in my life I have been happy to hear that the colts won.  as long as our front seven can keep him distracted, we'll be in it, but if he gets the ball in the air, it could be a long day.

I couldn't believe they overturned that forward pass call. I figured they'd say inconclusive evidence.

What I REALLY couldn't believe, was two straight runs with Westbrook. Just stupid.

A couple thoughts:

1.) The Giants ascension reminds of a lot of the beginning of the Pats dynasty:

a.) A come from behind Super Bowl win versus a seemingly unbeatable opponent.

b.) A talented QB's rise to statistical stardom.

c.) A crusty, misunderstood coach finding redemption.

2.) My second thought is that I believe most of the Super Bowl winners of the 90s would crush the Super Bowl winners of the 2000s. However, watching the Giants, particularly their offensive and defensive lines, I think they'd give the Cowboys, Niners, Broncos teams of the 90s a run for their money.

It is brutal being an Eagles fan. They had a whole game to figure out they couldn't run up the middle on the Giants. And when it matters most what do they do. They run the ball. I think Andy Reid is losing it and is preoccupied with off field issues that he can't call plays anymore. After such a hard fought game they had a chance to keep driving and perhaps take the lead. But no we like to leave it up to bad coaching instead of doing what was working. The Eagles may not have scored but at least they would have gone down fighting. Oh well we only have to win out if we want a shot at the playoffs. Go Eagles! LOL....

I'm an Eagles fan too-- it pains me to say it, but the better team won that game.

I was a bit surprised that the Eli-crossed-the-line-of-scrimmage-no-wait-he-didn't call was overturned. Looked very close to me.

You should maybe check out http://theticket.com/ It's a fantastic sports radio station out of Dallas, TX

I listen online sometimes even though we don't even live in TX anymore- it's that good. It tides me over while I'm waiting for the new book;)
comments.subject: sports talk

comments.article:
Dallas didn't lose!

Happy Marine Corps Birthday
comments.subject: Yay

comments.article:
That was truly a fun game to watch last night, especially since it's rare that I, Cowboys fan for life!!!, actually sit down and watch a game between the other NFC East bruisers. The Giants look like a team with very few weaknesses who have a tremendous chance to repeat. Their running game is just awesome.

On the flipside, what is up with Andy Reid's decision making in the fourth? Concerning the first challenge he made, I think that Al Michaels was being very generous by calling it a challenge of "desperation". It was just plain stupid. There was a lot of time left in the game and Jacobs was 100% down before the ball came out to anybody who has even decent vision, much less a coach with eyes and ears all around him to advise him on what to do. The second challenge on the touchdown fumble was a lot more understandable but the bottom line is those two timeouts may have given the Eagles one last gasp at the end.

The fourth down call Reid made to run instead of pass was mind-boggling as well. I've always thought Reid was a very intelligent coach, but he deserves all the criticism the Philly people throw his way this week after those decisions. And I totally agree, Jacobs needs to stay on the ground. He can run over almost anyone he doesn't scare out of his way, and aside from making himself vulnerable to fumble when he does those leaps, he just looks silly.

I truly hope that with Tony Romo, Felix Jones, and hopefully Terrence Newman coming back soon the wild card race within this division will only get more exciting (as of now, it looks like your G-Men have the division to lose). It all hinges on Sunday at the Skins for my Boys, though. If we lose that game the season is over. If we go into D.C. and get the win, there's a great chance we'll be 8-4 by Thanksgiving Day and ready for the December gauntlet.
comments.subject: The Beastly East

comments.article: Don't get too excited about the jets, it will be the ultimate hollywood ending when Pennington strides into the meadownlands to win the AFC east.
Go Big Blue!!! Jacobs dominated the running game and Ward showed his presence as well.  All I can ask is that Manning, the O-line and the running game show up for the Ravens this comming Sunday.
comments.subject: G-men

comments.article: Should be a great game on Thursday, we'll see if the Patriot's second string can take the AFC East lead all for themselves.  Too bad a lot of people won't get to watch it, including me.  Damn NFL Network.

Hmmm every week, huh? By my count he has done eight football posts so far this season, the 1st of which was just before the season started. Since the season is now going into week 11, I would say your count is a bit off. As he has stated pretty clearly, if you want info on the book go to the update page, if there's nothing new there then the book isn't done yet, check back the next day. Dumb @$$
comments.subject: Dumb @$$

comments.article:
I used to get upset about the football posts too. I don't read them anymore--Problem solved.

I do, however, wish that George would update the update page more often. I'm not asking for a detailed letter. Something along the lines of, "The novel is still coming along. The latest Jon chapter is shaping up nicely.

It doesn't even have to be true! Just a short blurb that confirms the continuing existence of the Song of Ice and Fire is all most fans need. Whaddaya say George?
comments.subject: Football posts

comments.article: You don't read the football posts anymore & yet, here you are replying on a football post. Isn't that interesting.
comments.subject: Re: Football posts

comments.article:
My Rams and my Chiefs keep getting worse and worse as each season passes. One would think there's light at the end of the tunnel, but I'm pretty sure our Mizzou Tigers could give the Rams and Chiefs a run for their money right about now.

Sad :(
comments.subject: Rams

comments.article:
1. On the hurdles, Jacobs made a horrible jump, but the one made by Kevin Boss over a defensive player was magical. He got just soo high.

2. I swear, the Eagles have the single worst two minute offense in the NFL. It's just awful. I remember with a little over 2 minutes remaining, the Eagles had the ball, and you're asking, come on, get a play off before the two minute warning... And McNabb just stands there in the huddle... he's tired... 20 seconds, 10 seconds, the two minute warning hits...

Just horrible clock management.
comments.subject: Two things.

comments.article: The talking heads here in NYC are laying the blame at Reid's feet. Listening to the Giants players' discussions about the game it seems as though they too expected him to more likely call running plays. Especially on the last run. I like McNabb, but I wonder if he had the option to call an option based on what the defense looked like to him. Maybe some of the blame goes to him. Dunno.
comments.subject: Re: Two things.
